intro: Strobilanthes pentandra, commonly known as the "Khasi flame of the forest," is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery red-orange flowers that bloom in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical forests and thrives in partial shade. Its flowering period is brief, usually occurring during the monsoon season, making it a rare and sought-after sight in its natural habitat. The plant is also valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
